title: How to Make a Gummy Cake

steps.headline: Make as many layers as you like.
steps.description: Three to four layers is probably the most you'll want to make to be effective and manageable.

steps.headline: Pour the cold water into a saucepan.
Add the jelly or jello crystals to the cold water.
Add the gelatine powder.
Set aside for 10 minutes.
steps.description: It will begin to thicken on its own.

steps.headline: Turn the heat to medium.
steps.description: Cook for 5 minutes, stirring frequently. It is ready when the ingredients have dissolved and the mixture is a smooth liquid. You can strain out any top bubbles if wished but it's not necessary.

steps.headline: Pour the liquid jelly or jello into the baking tin or pan.
steps.description: Let it sit in the pan to cool off for a quarter of an hour. If adding anything else, do so now. For example, shredded coconut, grated chocolate, small candies, pieces of fruit, etc.

steps.headline: Place it in the freezer to set.
steps.description: Leave for 30 to 40 minutes. If you have more time and prefer using the refrigerator, it will take about 2 to 3 hours to set.

steps.headline: Prepare the next jelly mix as for layer 1.
steps.description: Allow to cool properly after heating. Then pour it onto the already set layer 1. Freeze as with the first layer. Be sure to make each layer a different colour

steps.headline: Repeat until you've added all the desired layers.
Carefully turn the baking tin or pan upside down over a large cake plate.
steps.description: Before doing this, be absolutely sure that the gummy cake has set thoroughly. Lower it down gently. Tap to help it fall out in one piece.

steps.headline: Slice in the same way as for a flour baked cake.
Preheat the oven to 170ºC/325ºF.
steps.description: Line or grease the base and sides of the cake tins or pans.

steps.headline: Add the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder to the mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add the sugar, butter and eggs. Mix together until smooth.

steps.headline: Spoon into the prepared cake pans.
steps.description: Distribute the batter evenly between the two tins or pans.

steps.headline: Place in the oven.
steps.description: Bake for 30 minutes; do not open the door during this first half hour. The cake is done when it springs back if touched lightly in the centre.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Leave in the tins or pans to cool for 1 minute. Then transfer to a wire cooling rack and leave to cool completely.

steps.headline: Warm the jam in a small saucepan.
steps.description: This makes it easier to spread.

steps.headline: Spread the warmed jam on one side of each cake.
steps.description: Sandwich the cakes together.

steps.headline: Completely cover the cakes in frosting.
steps.description: Buttercream makes a good choice but it's up to you.

steps.headline: Decorate the cake with gummy candies.
steps.description: This can be done randomly or in a pattern such as rows, circles, a shape, a letter, etc. It's as simple as can be but it will look really effective when done. The more gummy candies, the merrier.

steps.headline: Allow to set.
steps.description: The gummy candies will firm into place as the frosting sets.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Place on a suitable cake plate or cake stand and serve in slices.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.
steps.description: Prepare the cupcake cases by arranging them across a baking tray or sheet. If preferred, you can place the cupcake cases inside the holes of a muffin pan.

steps.headline: Melt the chocolate with the water in a double boiler.
steps.description: Heat and stir until it turns smooth, then remove. Set aside to cool.

steps.headline: Sift the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt and sugar into the mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add the melted chocolate, butter, milk and vanilla extract.

steps.headline: Stir or beat to combine.
steps.description: Stir until the ingredients form a smooth batter.

steps.headline: Add the eggs.
steps.description: Stir until completely combined.

steps.headline: Transfer the mixture into the cupcake cases.
steps.description: Distribute the batter equally across all the cases.

steps.headline: Place in the preheated oven.
steps.description: Bake for 20-25 minutes. The cupcakes are done when a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Allow to cool on the tray or pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire cooling rack to cool completely.

steps.headline: Frost the top of each cupcake.
steps.description: Use the frosting of your choice.

steps.headline: Add the gummy candies.
steps.description: They can be added randomly, in a pattern or piled up in a heap.

steps.headline: Allow to set.
steps.description: Serve when the frosting has firmed.

text: Make as many layers as you like. Three to four layers is probably the most you'll want to make to be effective and manageable. Pour the cold water into a saucepan.  Add the jelly or jello crystals to the cold water.  Add the gelatine powder.  Set aside for 10 minutes. It will begin to thicken on its own. Turn the heat to medium. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring frequently. It is ready when the ingredients have dissolved and the mixture is a smooth liquid. You can strain out any top bubbles if wished but it's not necessary. Pour the liquid jelly or jello into the baking tin or pan. Let it sit in the pan to cool off for a quarter of an hour. If adding anything else, do so now. For example, shredded coconut, grated chocolate, small candies, pieces of fruit, etc. Place it in the freezer to set. Leave for 30 to 40 minutes. If you have more time and prefer using the refrigerator, it will take about 2 to 3 hours to set. Prepare the next jelly mix as for layer 1. Allow to cool properly after heating. Then pour it onto the already set layer 1. Freeze as with the first layer. Be sure to make each layer a different colour Repeat until you've added all the desired layers.  Carefully turn the baking tin or pan upside down over a large cake plate. Before doing this, be absolutely sure that the gummy cake has set thoroughly. Lower it down gently. Tap to help it fall out in one piece. Slice in the same way as for a flour baked cake.  Preheat the oven to 170ºC/325ºF. Line or grease the base and sides of the cake tins or pans. Add the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder to the mixing bowl. Add the sugar, butter and eggs. Mix together until smooth. Spoon into the prepared cake pans. Distribute the batter evenly between the two tins or pans. Place in the oven. Bake for 30 minutes; do not open the door during this first half hour. The cake is done when it springs back if touched lightly in the centre. Remove from the oven. Leave in the tins or pans to cool for 1 minute. Then transfer to a wire cooling rack and leave to cool completely. Warm the jam in a small saucepan. This makes it easier to spread. Spread the warmed jam on one side of each cake. Sandwich the cakes together. Completely cover the cakes in frosting. Buttercream makes a good choice but it's up to you. Decorate the cake with gummy candies. This can be done randomly or in a pattern such as rows, circles, a shape, a letter, etc. It's as simple as can be but it will look really effective when done. The more gummy candies, the merrier. Allow to set. The gummy candies will firm into place as the frosting sets. Serve. Place on a suitable cake plate or cake stand and serve in slices. Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF. Prepare the cupcake cases by arranging them across a baking tray or sheet. If preferred, you can place the cupcake cases inside the holes of a muffin pan. Melt the chocolate with the water in a double boiler. Heat and stir until it turns smooth, then remove. Set aside to cool. Sift the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt and sugar into the mixing bowl. Add the melted chocolate, butter, milk and vanilla extract. Stir or beat to combine. Stir until the ingredients form a smooth batter. Add the eggs. Stir until completely combined. Transfer the mixture into the cupcake cases. Distribute the batter equally across all the cases. Place in the preheated oven. Bake for 20-25 minutes. The cupcakes are done when a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Remove from the oven. Allow to cool on the tray or pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire cooling rack to cool completely. Frost the top of each cupcake. Use the frosting of your choice. Add the gummy candies. They can be added randomly, in a pattern or piled up in a heap. Allow to set. Serve when the frosting has firmed.
